column4: hi all, i created a webradio with mpd+icecast2, and it's available at http://ip_adresss:port  and i would like to know if it's possible to make the website available like this http://paissad-radio.com for example without entering the port number
Is the server currently running on paissad-radio.com's IP address?
nick125 the server is running on http:paissad.homelinux:18000
Ah! I thought that 18000 sounded a bit high :)
you think that the port number is high ?

You have at least 3 options. 1) You can create a site that links to or plays http://paissad.homelinux.com:1800/mpd.ogg 2) You can use Apache + mod_proxy to forward requests to localhost:1800 3) You can change the IceCast server to run on port 80, if you aren't wanting to use Apache for anything else.
nick125 i just don't know anything about proxy :s ...
nick125 i heard about squid, tor, but that 's all :D
With mod_proxy, you can tell apache to send specific URLs to another port and then display the results - so all of your other stuff wont be hurt when you use port 80.
nick125 ok mod_proxy seems good, i take a look on it :) ... thanks, i go STFW & RTFM
